posts.title: O Roninho é um garoto Legal
posts.body:
To attach an event handler to a specific element, you have to use the addEventListener() method.

This method is used to attach an event handler to a specified element in a way that doesn’t overwrite other present event handlers.

Multiple event handlers may be applied to a single element, i.e. two click events assigned to an element.

Any DOM object may be assigned an event handler, which includes not only HTML elements, but, for example, the window itself as well.

The method addEventListener() can make it easier to control the way an event reacts to bubbling.
